intro: Linderniella pulchella, commonly known as the pretty lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue-violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial shade to full sun. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it is often found in wetlands and along streambanks. Linderniella pulchella is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
